content.question: For time <math alttext="t greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> , the acceleration of a particle moving along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis is given by <math alttext="a, of t, equals, cosine t, plus t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the velocity of the particle is 8 and the position of the particle is 0. What is the position of the particle at time <math alttext="t equals, pi over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator the square root of 2, and denominator 2, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator pi squared, and denominator 32, end fraction, plus 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the negative of the fraction with numerator the square root of 2, and denominator 2, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator pi cubed, and denominator 384" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>384</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the negative of the fraction with numerator the square root of 2, and denominator 2, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator pi cubed, and denominator 384, end fraction, plus 2 pi, plus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>384</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator the square root of 2, and denominator 2, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator pi cubed, and denominator 384, end fraction, plus 2 pi, minus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>384</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the negative of the fraction with numerator the square root of 2, and denominator 2, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator pi cubed, and denominator 384, end fraction, plus 2 pi, plus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>384</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
